intro: Dortmanna patula, commonly known as the common dock, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 60–120 cm, featuring basal rosettes of large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters during the summer months, which are followed by kidney-shaped seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along riverbanks. Dortmanna patula is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its astringent and anti-inflammatory effects.
